templateDescription: Assessment template for certifying DHIS2 server implementations against security, performance, and deployment best practices.

categories.name: PostgreSQL Database Controls
categories.description: Database security, backup, and configuration controls for PostgreSQL

criteria.name: Regular Automated Database Backup
criteria.description: Automated daily backups must be configured with defined retention policies and integrity verification mechanisms.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review backup configuration files; verify backup logs from past 30 days; confirm retention policy documentation; test backup integrity checksums.
criteria.evidenceDescription: Backup configuration files, backup logs, retention policy documentation

criteria.name: Database Backup Restore Testing
criteria.description: Periodic restore tests must be performed to a non-production environment to validate backup integrity and recovery procedures.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review restore test documentation from past 6 months; verify test results and lessons learned; confirm non-production test environment exists.
criteria.evidenceDescription: Restore test documentation, test results, lessons learned

criteria.name: Off-Site Backup Storage
criteria.description: Backup copies must be stored off-site or in a separate region/account to protect against site-wide disasters.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify off-site backup location and access controls.
criteria.evidenceDescription: Off-site backup configuration, storage location details

criteria.name: Database Least Privilege Access
criteria.description: Database users must be assigned minimum necessary privileges; administrative and service accounts must be separated; regular access reviews required.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review database user roles and permissions; verify the DHIS2 user only has access to the required DHIS2 database, and from the DHIS2 IP address.
criteria.evidenceDescription: Database user roles listing, permission matrix

criteria.name: Database Backup File Permissions
criteria.description: Backup artifacts must inherit restrictive permissions (Unix mode 660) and must not be world-readable.
criteria.verificationMethod: Audit backup file permissions; verify backup scripts include proper permission settings; check for world-readable backup files.

criteria.name: Database Encryption at Rest
criteria.description: Full-disk encryption must be enabled with secure key management practices separate from data storage.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify encryption configuration; review key management procedures; confirm encryption status of all database volumes.

criteria.name: Backup Encryption at Rest
criteria.description: Backups must be encrypted at rest with encryption keys managed separately from the backup storage location.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify backup encryption configuration; confirm key storage separation; test encrypted backup restore procedure.
criteria.evidenceDescription: Backup encryption settings, key storage location

criteria.name: PostgreSQL Host-Based Access Control
criteria.description: pg_hba.conf must restrict host-based access, enforce TLS connections, and use SCRAM-SHA-256 authentication over MD5.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review pg_hba.conf file; ensure the DHIS2 instance user only has access to the DHIS2 database, and from the DHIS2 IP address. Verify TLS enforcement; confirm SCRAM authentication enabled; check for MD5 usage.

criteria.name: Supported PostgreSQL Version (Non-EOL)
criteria.description: PostgreSQL must be a supported version that is not past end-of-life as per the official PostgreSQL support schedule at the time of assessment.
criteria.verificationMethod: Run SELECT version(); and capture output; compare against the PostgreSQL version support/EOL matrix; review OS package source and pinned version.
criteria.evidenceDescription: PostgreSQL version output, EOL matrix comparison

criteria.name: PostgreSQL Tuning Baseline
criteria.description: PostgreSQL must have JIT disabled and max_locks_per_transaction set to 128 to support DHIS2 workload characteristics and reduce query planning overhead.
criteria.verificationMethod: Run SHOW jit; (expect off) and SHOW max_locks_per_transaction; (expect 128); verify corresponding entries in postgresql.conf and effective reload/restart logs.
criteria.evidenceDescription: SHOW jit and SHOW max_locks_per_transaction output

categories.name: Deployment and TLS Controls
categories.description: TLS/SSL configuration and deployment environment controls

criteria.name: TLS/SSL Configuration
criteria.description: TLS 1.2 or higher with modern cipher suites must be enforced; HSTS enabled; SSL Labs rating of A or A+ required.
criteria.verificationMethod: Run SSL Labs scan; verify TLS version and cipher configuration; confirm HSTS header; review certificate validity.
criteria.evidenceDescription: SSL Labs scan results, HSTS header verification

criteria.name: Pre-Production Testing Environment
criteria.description: A staging or test environment should exist for validating changes before production deployment.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review deployment procedures; verify staging environment exists; examine release checklist documentation and sign-offs.

categories.name: Operating System Security
categories.description: Linux server hardening, SSH configuration, patching, and monitoring controls

criteria.name: Disable Direct Root SSH Access
criteria.description: Direct root login via SSH must be disabled; sudo with individual named accounts required for administrative access.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review sshd_config for PermitRootLogin setting; verify sudo configuration; check for individual admin accounts.

criteria.name: SSH Key-Based Authentication
criteria.description: SSH key-based authentication must be enforced; keys must be rotated regularly; weak algorithms disabled.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify SSH key configuration; check for password authentication disabled; review authorized_keys; confirm algorithm restrictions.

criteria.name: SSH Password Authentication Disabled
criteria.description: SSH password authentication must be disabled (PasswordAuthentication no); strong key exchange and MAC algorithms enforced.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review sshd_config for PasswordAuthentication, KexAlgorithms, and MACs settings; test password login attempt (should fail).

criteria.name: SSH Configuration File Permissions
criteria.description: SSH configuration and key files must have restrictive permissions (600/640/660) with proper ownership.
criteria.verificationMethod: Audit permissions on /etc/ssh/sshd_config, private keys, authorized_keys; verify ownership; check umask.
criteria.evidenceDescription: ls -la output of SSH config and key files

criteria.name: Automated Security Patching
criteria.description: Unattended security updates must be enabled with defined reboot strategy; patch status monitoring required.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify unattended-upgrades or equivalent service; review patch logs; confirm reboot policy; check patch compliance dashboard.

criteria.name: DHIS2 Application File Permissions
criteria.description: DHIS2 configuration files and logs must be owned by service accounts with non-world-readable permissions.
criteria.verificationMethod: Audit DHIS2 conf/ and logs/ directories; verify ownership and permissions; confirm no world-readable sensitive files.

criteria.name: System Monitoring and Alerting
criteria.description: Host and service monitoring must be implemented for CPU, memory, disk, web proxy, and database with alerting thresholds.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review monitoring platform configuration; verify alert rules and thresholds; confirm notification channels; test alert delivery.

criteria.name: Operating System Encryption at Rest
criteria.description: Full-disk encryption must be enabled on servers and volumes (LUKS/FileVault/BitLocker or equivalent).
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify encryption status of system volumes; review key management procedures; confirm encryption is active at boot.

criteria.name: Operating System Least Privilege
criteria.description: OS users must be assigned minimum necessary privileges with role separation; periodic access reviews required.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review user accounts and group memberships; verify sudo configurations; check access review documentation from past quarter.

criteria.name: Network Service Exposure Control
criteria.description: Host and network firewalls must implement default-deny ingress; only required services/ports exposed to internet.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review firewall rules; perform port scan from external network; verify only necessary ports accessible; check default policies.
criteria.evidenceDescription: Firewall rules, external port scan results

criteria.name: Centralized Security Event Logging
criteria.description: Security alerts and logs must be forwarded to SIEM with accurate timestamps and integrity protection.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify log forwarding configuration; confirm SIEM receiving logs; check timestamp synchronization; review log integrity mechanisms.

criteria.name: Host-Based Intrusion Detection
criteria.description: HIDS/EDR must be deployed with alerting enabled and documented response playbooks.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify HIDS/EDR agent installation and status; review alert configuration; confirm response playbooks exist and are current.

criteria.name: Network-Based Intrusion Detection
criteria.description: NIDS sensors must monitor network traffic with tuned signatures and alerting capabilities.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify NIDS deployment and coverage; review signature updates; check alert tuning documentation; confirm monitoring scope.

criteria.name: Minimal Service Footprint
criteria.description: Only required services and daemons must be active; unnecessary services removed/disabled; validation after system updates.
criteria.verificationMethod: List running services; compare against approved baseline; verify service necessity; check post-update validation procedures.

categories.name: DHIS2 Application Security
categories.description: DHIS2-specific application security controls including admin access and MFA

criteria.name: Default Admin Account Security
criteria.description: DHIS2 default 'admin' account must be disabled/renamed; unique administrator credentials with strong authentication required.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify default admin account status; confirm unique admin usernames; review password complexity requirements.

criteria.name: Administrative Access Limitation
criteria.description: DHIS2 administrative users must be limited to approximately 1% of total user population; quarterly access reviews required.
criteria.verificationMethod: Query admin role assignments; calculate percentage of admin users; review quarterly access review documentation.
criteria.evidenceDescription: Admin user count, total user count, access review records

criteria.name: Multi-Factor Authentication (Admins)
criteria.description: MFA must be enforced for all DHIS2 administrative accounts; hardware or app-based tokens preferred.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify MFA configuration for admin accounts; review MFA enrollment status; test MFA enforcement at login.

criteria.name: Multi-Factor Authentication (Users)
criteria.description: MFA should be offered/enforced for all DHIS2 users where feasible; risk-based authentication policies recommended.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review MFA availability and adoption rates; verify risk-based authentication policies; check MFA user documentation.

criteria.name: Tomcat Service Account
criteria.description: Tomcat must run under a dedicated service account with minimal privileges; must not run as root.
criteria.verificationMethod: Check Tomcat process ownership; verify service account configuration; confirm absence of root privileges.
criteria.evidenceDescription: ps aux output showing Tomcat process owner

criteria.name: Tomcat Shutdown Port Security
criteria.description: Tomcat SHUTDOWN port must be disabled or firewalled; if required, restrict to localhost only.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review server.xml for SHUTDOWN port configuration; verify firewall rules; test external accessibility.

criteria.name: Application Auto-Deployment Disabled
criteria.description: Tomcat auto-deployment must be disabled.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review server.xml and Host configuration for autoDeploy setting.

criteria.name: Webapp Modification Prevention
criteria.description: File permissions must prevent Tomcat runtime from modifying deployed application artifacts (webapps directory).
criteria.verificationMethod: Audit webapps directory permissions; verify Tomcat user cannot write to deployment directories.

criteria.name: Layered Firewall Architecture
criteria.description: Defense-in-depth firewall strategy required: perimeter, host-based, and container-based; default-deny with change control.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review firewall architecture documentation; verify multiple firewall layers; confirm default-deny policies; check change management process.

categories.name: Access Control
categories.description: Administrative access and account management controls

criteria.name: Multiple Administrative Accounts
criteria.description: Multiple break-glass admin accounts required (2-4 recommended); usage must be monitored and logged.
criteria.verificationMethod: Verify number of admin accounts; review admin account usage logs; confirm monitoring and alerting on admin activity.

criteria.name: Individual SSH Account Accountability
criteria.description: Each SSH user must have a unique, named account; shared credentials prohibited; MFA enforced where possible.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review /etc/passwd for user accounts; verify no shared accounts exist; check SSH authentication methods and MFA status.

criteria.name: User Home Directory Hygiene
criteria.description: User home directories must not contain sensitive data or unprotected keys; proper permissions enforced.
criteria.verificationMethod: Audit home directories for sensitive files; check for SSH keys, credentials, configs; verify directory permissions.

categories.name: Security Governance & Processes
categories.description: Organizational security policies, procedures, and governance controls

criteria.name: Security Leadership Accountability
criteria.description: Designated security manager with defined responsibilities and authority must be appointed.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review organizational chart; verify security manager job description and responsibilities; confirm active engagement.
criteria.evidenceDescription: Org chart, security manager job description

criteria.name: Security Program Development
criteria.description: Formal security program with documented policies, standards, procedures, and training plan required.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review security program documentation; verify policies are current and approved; check training records; confirm awareness activities.

criteria.name: Enterprise Asset Inventory
criteria.description: Current inventory of enterprise assets with owners, locations, and configurations must be maintained.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review asset inventory system; verify completeness and accuracy; confirm owner assignments; check update frequency.

criteria.name: Incident Response Plan
criteria.description: Documented incident response plan with defined roles, runbooks, communication procedures, and legal considerations.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review IR plan documentation; verify contact lists current; check runbooks for common scenarios; confirm legal review.

criteria.name: Data Sharing Agreements
criteria.description: Formal data sharing agreements and NDAs with contractual safeguards and retention clauses required for external parties.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review executed data sharing agreements; verify NDA coverage; confirm retention and destruction clauses; check legal approval.

criteria.name: DHIS2 User Offboarding Procedure
criteria.description: Immediate deprovisioning workflow for departing users integrated with HR offboarding process.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review offboarding procedures; verify integration with HR; test deprovisioning timeline; check recent offboarding tickets.

criteria.name: OS User Offboarding Procedure
criteria.description: System access revocation upon termination; prompt removal from sudoers and privileged groups.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review OS offboarding procedures; verify timeline compliance; check removal from groups/sudoers; audit recent offboardings.

criteria.name: Risk Assessment Program
criteria.description: Periodic risk assessments conducted with documented findings and mitigation tracking.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review most recent risk assessment; verify assessment methodology; check mitigation plan and status; confirm periodic schedule.

criteria.name: Internal Security Audits
criteria.description: Scheduled internal security audits with documented findings, assigned owners, and remediation deadlines.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review internal audit schedule and reports; verify finding closure tracking; confirm owner assignments; check remediation status.

criteria.name: External Security Audits
criteria.description: Periodic third-party security audits and penetration testing conducted by qualified assessors.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review external audit reports from past 12 months; verify assessor qualifications; check remediation of findings; confirm test scope.
criteria.evidenceDescription: External audit reports, penetration test results

criteria.name: Incident Response Testing
criteria.description: Regular testing and exercises of incident response procedures to ensure readiness.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review IR exercise documentation; verify lessons learned; confirm plan updates based on exercises.

criteria.name: Security Metrics and KPIs
criteria.description: Key security and compliance metrics tracked and reported to management at least quarterly.
criteria.verificationMethod: Review KPI dashboard; verify metrics definition; check reporting frequency to leadership; confirm trend analysis.

certificationModel.description: Binary certification outcome based on target Implementation Group compliance

pass.description: All required Technical controls for target IG are COMPLIANT

fail.description: One or more required Technical controls are NON_COMPLIANT or NOT_TESTED
fail.action: No certificate issued; assessment can be resumed after remediation

IG1.name: Essential Cyber Hygiene
IG1.description: Foundational security controls for basic cyber defense
IG1.passRequirement: All IG1 Technical controls must be COMPLIANT

IG2.name: Intermediate Security
IG2.description: Additional controls for organizations managing sensitive data
IG2.targetProfile: Organizations with IT resources managing sensitive data
IG2.passRequirement: All IG1 + IG2 Technical controls must be COMPLIANT

IG3.name: Advanced Security
IG3.targetProfile: Highly regulated environments with significant cybersecurity expertise
IG3.passRequirement: All IG1 + IG2 + IG3 Technical controls must be COMPLIANT
